channel.title: World : NPR
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2022 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What Europe's ban of Russian oil could mean for energy markets – and your gas prices
item.description: The EU ban on Russian oil imports will likely lead to higher crude and gasoline prices, further upending energy markets.
item.content:encoded:
The EU ban on Russian oil imports will likely lead to higher crude and gasoline prices, further upending energy markets.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittany Cronin

item.title: The U.S. may soon export more gas to the EU, but that will complicate climate goals
item.description: To help wean Europe off Russian gas, the Biden administration wants to increase U.S. natural gas exports. But critics say that's at odds with the president's climate and environmental justice goals.
item.content:encoded: To help wean Europe off Russian gas, the Biden administration wants to increase U.S. natural gas exports. But critics say that's at odds with the president's climate and environmental justice goals.
item.dc:creator: Halle Parker

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 4)
item.description: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

(Image credit: Hannibal Hanschke/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: The EU says it plans to ban Russian oil by the end of the year
item.description: The European Union says it intends to phase out Russian oil in the next few months. This was part of a package of new sanctions the EU announced Wednesday against Russia for its war in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: The European Union says it intends to phase out Russian oil in the next few months. This was part of a package of new sanctions the EU announced Wednesday against Russia for its war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister says Mariupol is still in Ukrainian hands
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly interviews Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba about the state of the war and where things might go from here.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly interviews Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba about the state of the war and where things might go from here.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Maradona's 'Hand of God' shirt fetches $9.3M at auction, a sports memorabilia record
item.description: The shirt was worn by the Argentine soccer legend when he scored the controversial "Hand of God" goal against England in the 1986 World Cup.
item.content:encoded:
The shirt was worn by the Argentine soccer legend when he scored the controversial "Hand of God" goal against England in the 1986 World Cup.

(Image credit: Matt Dunham/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Dave Chappelle attacker charged with assault with a deadly weapon
item.description: 23-year-old Isaiah Lee has been charged with assault with a deadly weapon.
item.content:encoded:
23-year-old Isaiah Lee has been charged with assault with a deadly weapon.

(Image credit: Vivien Killilea/Getty Images for Imagine LA)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Premature American twins rescued from Ukraine become stuck in bureaucratic limbo
item.description: For two parents from Chicago, getting their newborn twins safely out of Ukraine was difficult. Two months later, extracting them from Poland's bureaucracy has turned out to be even more arduous.
item.content:encoded:
For two parents from Chicago, getting their newborn twins safely out of Ukraine was difficult. Two months later, extracting them from Poland's bureaucracy has turned out to be even more arduous.

(Image credit: Alex Spektor)
item.dc:creator: Ari Shapiro

item.title: The EU just proposed a ban on oil from Russia, its main energy supplier
item.description: The European Union wants to sharpen its sanctions against Russia. But its leaders acknowledge Europe's economy could suffer.
item.content:encoded:
The European Union wants to sharpen its sanctions against Russia. But its leaders acknowledge Europe's economy could suffer.

(Image credit: Jean-Francois Badias/AP)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: A Canadian official says Americans can get abortions there if Roe is overturned
item.description: Americans accessing health care services in Canada would have to pay out of pocket, and likely would need to overcome extra travel and logistical hurdles.
item.content:encoded:
Americans accessing health care services in Canada would have to pay out of pocket, and likely would need to overcome extra travel and logistical hurdles.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: EU proposes a ban on Russian oil imports
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Ben Cahill at the Center for Strategic and International Studies about a European Union proposal to phase out imports of Russian oil and refined products.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Ben Cahill at the Center for Strategic and International Studies about a European Union proposal to phase out imports of Russian oil and refined products.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Evacuees from Mariupol describe how they survived inside the Azovstal steel plant
item.description: "Like the apocalypse, like a horror film," is how one evacuee describes weeks of sheltering in the vast, Soviet-era steel plant. Her daughter says, "Each day felt like it would be our last one alive."
item.content:encoded:
"Like the apocalypse, like a horror film," is how one evacuee describes weeks of sheltering in the vast, Soviet-era steel plant. Her daughter says, "Each day felt like it would be our last one alive."

(Image credit: Chris McGrath/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: 85-year-old bassist Ron Carter has no plans on slowing down
item.description: The roster of musicians Carter has worked with ranges from Ornette Coleman to Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack and A Tribe Called Quest.
item.content:encoded:
The roster of musicians Carter has worked with ranges from Ornette Coleman to Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack and A Tribe Called Quest.

(Image credit: Didier Baverel/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Tom Vitale

item.title: EU leader calls for Russian oil ban in new set of sanctions
item.description: The EU chief concedes that that getting all 27 member countries — some of them highly dependent on Russia for energy supplies — to agree on oil sanctions will be extremely difficult.
item.content:encoded:
The EU chief concedes that that getting all 27 member countries — some of them highly dependent on Russia for energy supplies — to agree on oil sanctions will be extremely difficult.

(Image credit: Jean-Francois Badias/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: As U.S. may restrict abortion, other nations are easing access
item.description: Recent legislative activities in countries show the U.S. risks being out of step with the progress that the rest of the world is making in protecting sexual and reproductive rights.
item.content:encoded:
Recent legislative activities in countries show the U.S. risks being out of step with the progress that the rest of the world is making in protecting sexual and reproductive rights.

(Image credit: Natacha Pisarenko/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
